Author: jl777c#5810
Content: wow,I lose internet for a few hours and my channel becomes about naming?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ./komodod -ac* -> runtime fork that creates a new blockchain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: now with millions of possible coin emissions possible

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: CC can be enabled or not

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if enabled a CCid cluster can be created and a built in fungibility within the cluster activated

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this is from a SINGLE burn protocol contract implemented in the CCid >= 3 case, which creates a cluster

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: VRSC forked komodo and added many vrsc unique for now -ac options, which in time will come back into komodod

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: now I know people love to debate names, since everybody can have a valid opinion since it isnt technical and you dont have to worry about segfaults or compiler bugs. But that takes it out of the technical domian, which this channel should stick to.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: VRSC will be automatically spawning new chains (actually the miner will be doing this) and they are called autochains

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so the name is *chain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: where * can be anything

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: having one name to describe every possible thing will lead to a name that is overloaded

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so no matter what single name is used, people will complain that it doesnt make sense in all the other cases. I try to avoid getting involved in things that dont have a deterministic conclusion as it can easily take infinite time

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I suggest that marketing create a marketable name for each different type of usecase. Maybe we can even get press coverage for each different name (usecase) from the same ./komodod -ac* runtime fork ability

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: when I originally implemented this it was because I was too lazy to make N source code forks for all the different SuperNET assets, so I made -ac_name= option and called it assetchains

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then I added ability to be mined as on-demand chains only made sense for infrequently used assets

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then I added PoS/PoW and different coin emissions

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then -ac_cc=1 with CC enabled

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then VRSC added their options

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then with MoMoM -ac_cc=<clusterid>

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so it has just expanded and evolved as it has been the path of least resistance from a technical side to add new abilities

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and what we havent released yet, but have announced are coin specific CC eval functions that allow to blockchain enforce any (and by any, I mean any) boolean evaluator. This might sound not so much, but when you can run native code to evaluate to a boolean, you can do things like evalpokerhand(op-return data of pokerhand, payoutvector)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then given a poker hand (signed in realtime) you can approve a blockchain payout of a pokerhand, blockchain enforced and not needing any multiple signers

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: The burn protocol was able to be implemented so quickly due to the fact that solving realtime poker being blockchain enforced has been the overall goal, with the assumption that most other decentralization problems will be easier to solve and likely some variation of a subset of the realtime poker solution

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so we can have a bunch of game specific chains, what to call them? is there a single name for chains with a boolean eval function, or do we name each subset of chains that have something in common (card games, casino games, multiplayer games)?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this i leave to marketing to solve, it will be enough work to get all this tech working without having to worry about the perfect way to name it

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: The marketing team is open to input on naming for KMD 2.0 technical features.  Some of the terminology we've been using are:

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: MoMoM - Federated Multi-chain Syncing

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: Linking multiple chains as one - inter-chain linking / multi-chain linking

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: Branding of scaling solution: InfiniScale

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: Asset Chain rename - Parallel Chains / ScaleChains (dual meaning with scales of a lizard and the literal technical descriptor)

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: Cross-Chain Smart/Simple Contracts

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: Blockchain Bridging - Full interop to blockchains outside our ecosystem via MoMoM

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content:
"Asset Chain rename - Parallel Chains / ScaleChains"
imo, "ScaleChains" would bring up the implication issue from earlier, whereby the name suggests that those chains are somehow utilized to offset scaling of the network and the intended correlation to the lizard/komodo theme would be lost on most folks

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: good point, noted.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
ILP: https://interledger.org/rfcs/0001-interledger-architecture/

CryptoConditions:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-thomas-crypto-conditions-04
https://de.slideshare.net/Interledger/ilp-workshop-cryptoconditions

SimpleContracts:
https://blog.bigchaindb.com/stateless-stateful-smart-contracts-9b8ed2c36bbf
https://blog.bigchaindb.com/an-argument-against-smart-contracts-57f4f2a05b3d

ILP Payment methods:
https://w3c.github.io/webpayments/proposals/interledger/
https://w3c.github.io/payment-handler/

CryptoConditions extra resources:
http://www.lifewithalacrity.com/2016/10/smarter-signatures-experiments-in-verifications/

Merkle root:
https://bitcoin.stackexchange.com/questions/10479/what-is-the-merkle-root

SPV:
https://www.coindesk.com/spv-support-billion-bitcoin-users-sizing-scaling-claim/

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: Other than that reading Mastering Bitcoin from Andreas is also good to get better understanding of blockchain and spv

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: Is merged mining just an implementation detail of mining software or only some kind of coins be merge mined? I am asking as I think that this could be a solution to the problem of splitting hashpower between a lot of fungible chains connected with `ac_cc` for the purpose of scaling tx/s

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Hey that's a really good idea!

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: It would require code change, as merged mining is part of the consensus as far as I am aware, you can't merge mine any coin.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Having a single miner for all chains, or even each 64 chain cluster, would mean we need even less CPUs.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: Will komodo daemon source code need to be changed to allow for merged mining?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: also miners have to support it

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
```
To do any harm to the blockchains that are getting dPOW(i.e., not add a particular blockchain's checkpoint to BTC), all the notaries that get to sign a particular transaction have to collude and notaries don't get to choose which other notaries to sign the transaction with. On the random chance only the colluding notaries can get together and not notarize a blockchain intentionally, the community would just kick all of the colluding notories.
``` 
Is this statement true?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the power of notaries is to withold notarization

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as each notarization is validated by all nodes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so not sure what "colluding" will achieve, other than reducing the notarization frequncy

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and such notaries that are coluding to withhold notarizations will have a lower notarizing total and have to go through election cycle. it wont be easily determinatble that a notary is part of the colluding non-notrizers

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: Coming up with fancy animal names isn't the key thing. The goal is creating a technical name that describes the independent chains. Eth has ERC20, QTum has QRC, and NEM has Mosaics which fits them. An ideal name is easy to use and adds marketing value. If I hear the word Spore chains..... That doesn't tell me much. If I hear KIC and I research and find that KIC stands for Komodo Independent Chain. Then that makes more sense.

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: Verus calls theirs autochains

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: Which still has more marketing value than assetchains

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: Auto can be autonomous or automatic

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: Which in a way its both
